availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Kentucky soldier. Virginia native. Son of James Flanery and Mary Minter Flanery. Married to Nancy A. Brandenburgh Flanery in Owsley County, Kentucky on December 14, 1858. Father of James H. Flanery, Lucy A. Flanery, and Mary J. Flanery. Served in the 7th Kentucky Infantry (U.S.A.) as 1st sergeant from August 19, 1861 to July 26, 1862. Served in the 7th Kentucky Infantry (U.S.A.) as 2nd lieutenant from July 26, 1862 to March 1, 1863. Served in the 7th Kentucky Infantry (U.S.A.) as 1st lieutenant from March 1, 1863 to .

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Virginia, Scott County, Western District, p. 395B.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Owsley County, Travellers Rest, p. 344A.
Kentucky Birth, Marriage and Death Records – Microfilm (1852-1910), KDLA, Roll #994027-994058, Owsley County Marriages, p. 7 of 21 of microfilm.
Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers who Served in Organizations From State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 212.
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 1, 1861-1866 (Frankfort: Kentucky Yeoman Office, 1866), 756.
Vital Statistics Original Death Certificates – Microfilm (1911-1964), KDLA, Roll #7016189, Owsley County Deaths, File #16791.
Find A Grave, "Samuel Hampton Flanery (Oct 18, 1833-Jul 31, 1927)," Memorial #111664373, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/111664373 (accessed July 29, 2020).
